name: Yellow Flower Tarweed, Narrow tarplant, Pit Gland tarweed
overview: Native, non-invasive species. The resin, which tar plants excrete from their leaves, traps insects that could be potentially harmful to the plant. Blooms from May to November and is federally endangered.
habitat: Annual plant found throughout the reserve, typically in open areas or near the edges of trails/roads.
